resource.title: Package Leaflet: Information for the user - Aprokam 50 mg Powder

section.title: 1. What Aprokam is and what it is used for

coding.display: What X is and what it is used for

text.div: Aprokam contains cefuroxime (as sodium). It is an antibiotic used to prevent eye infections after cataract surgery.

section.title: 2. What you need to know before you take Aprokam

coding.display: What you need to know before you take X

text.div: Do not be given Aprokam if you are allergic to cefuroxime, or any of the cephalosporin antibiotics.
Aprokam will be administered by an ophthalmic surgeon.
Rare side effects include serious allergic reaction.
Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children. Store below 25°C. Keep vial in the outer carton.

section.title: 6. Contents of the pack and other information

coding.display: Contents of the pack and other information

text.div: The active substance is cefuroxime (as sodium). Each vial contains 50 mg cefuroxime.

resource.indication: Antibiotikaprofylax mot postoperativ endoftalmit efter kataraktoperation. Beakta de officiella riktlinjerna gällande korrekt användning av antibakteriella läkemedel, inkluderande riktlinjer för antibiotikaprofylax vid ögonkirurgi.

coding.display: Medicinal product subject to medical prescription

name.productName: Aprokam 50 mg Pulver till injektionsvätska, lösning

coding.display: Antibiotic prophylaxis of postoperative endophthalmitis after cataract surgery

dosage.text: 0.1 ml of reconstituted solution (1 mg) intended for intracameral injection
